text: Mr. Love is a 1985 British comedy film directed by Roy Battersby and starring Barry Jackson, Maurice Denham and Margaret Tyzack.BFI.org It was made by Goldcrest Films. Its budget was £486,000.Alexander Walker, Icons in the Fire: The Rise and Fall of Practically Everyone in the British Film Industry 1984-2000, Orion Books, 2005 p31 Goldcrest Films invested the £486,000 and received £330,000, recording a loss of £156,000. ==Plot== A mild-mannered gardener becomes a lovable legend in his town for his talent to romantically please every woman that fancies him. ==Production== The film was filmed at several notable locations in England, mainly in Southport, Merseyside and at Phoenix Cinema in East Finchley."Mr. Love", Turner Classic Movies: article.
